comment.author: 34298210@N08
comment._content: It is so sad that their decendants have lost this treasure forever.

comment.author: 86995348@N00
comment._content: Sometimes the descendants die out--yes even in the case of 19th Century families with many children.  That photo is just a moment in time.  By the next year one or more of the sitters can have died because medicine did not have much power to save lives back then.  Many more people died young compared to after the advent of antibiotics and good surgical techniques in the 20th Century.  Some of those who lived on may never have married or, even if they did, never had children.  Heirlooms find their way into estate sales and old photos, especially lovely Daguerreotypes like this one, are purchased by strangers as collector's items.
